result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel W Kraft

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM (22CF02/22CF14/22TR159) Defendant Daniel W Kraft not in court.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for Daniel W Kraft.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Snow does not have any knowledge of where the def is at this time; Atty Kunisch requests bench warrant and bond forfeiture; Court orders warrant and bond forfeiture in cases 22CF02 and 22CF14. 
22TR159 to be addressed once def is located.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel W Kraft in court.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for Daniel W Kraft. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 010811,
Payable Number: 238167,
Receipt Number: 22R 000977,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:54 PM Defendant Daniel W Kraft in custody via video with attorney Alyssa F. George (jail only); Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel W Kraft appeared by video means; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $100,000 Cash bond; Atty. George response; Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 2/17/22 at 8:30am in Br. 4 & Review 2/2/22 at 8:15am in Br. 3; Court sets $10,000.00 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
